info.title: Aggregate Offer API
info.description: When a single product is associated with multiple offers (for example, the same pair of shoes is offered by different merchants), then AggregateOffer can be used.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Keyword search for item

parameters.name: acceptedpaymentmethod
parameters.description: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

parameters.name: additionaltype
parameters.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

parameters.name: addon
parameters.description: An additional offer that can only be obtained in combination with the first base offer (e.g. supplements and extensions that are available for a surcharge).

parameters.name: advancebookingrequirement
parameters.description: The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.

parameters.name: aggregaterating
parameters.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

parameters.name: alternatename
parameters.description: An alias for the item.

parameters.name: areaserved
parameters.description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided. Supersedes serviceArea.
parameters.type: text or  place or  geoshape or  administrativearea

parameters.name: availability
parameters.description: The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.

parameters.name: availabilityends
parameters.description: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

parameters.name: availabilitystarts
parameters.description: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

parameters.name: availableatorfrom
parameters.description: The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).

parameters.name: availabledeliverymethod
parameters.description: The delivery method(s) available for this offer.

parameters.name: businessfunction
parameters.description: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

parameters.name: deliveryleadtime
parameters.description: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods leaving the warehouse.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A short description of the item.

parameters.name: eligiblecustomertype
parameters.description: The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.

parameters.name: eligibleduration
parameters.description: The duration for which the given offer is valid.

parameters.name: eligiblequantity
parameters.description: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

parameters.name: eligibleregion
parameters.description: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.       See also ineligibleRegion.

parameters.name: eligibletransactionvolume
parameters.description: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

parameters.name: gtin12
parameters.description: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

parameters.name: gtin13
parameters.description: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

parameters.name: gtin14
parameters.description: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

parameters.name: gtin8
parameters.description: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

parameters.name: highprice
parameters.description: The highest price of all offers available.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

parameters.name: includesobject
parameters.description: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in the offer.

parameters.name: ineligibleregion
parameters.description: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.       See also eligibleRegion.

parameters.name: inventorylevel
parameters.description: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

parameters.name: itemcondition
parameters.description: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

parameters.name: itemoffered
parameters.description: The item being offered.

parameters.name: lowprice
parameters.description: The lowest price of all offers available.

parameters.name: mainentityofpage
parameters.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.            See background notes for details.       Inverse property: mainEntity.

parameters.name: mpn
parameters.description: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the item.

parameters.name: offercount
parameters.description: The number of offers for the product.

parameters.name: offeredby
parameters.description: A pointer to the organization or person making the offer. Inverse property: makesOffer.

parameters.name: offers
parameters.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

parameters.name: potentialaction
parameters.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.      Usage guidelines:Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. "USD") instead of      including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value.      Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.      Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values      alongside more human-friendly formatting.      Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

parameters.name: pricecurrency
parameters.description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

parameters.name: pricespecification
parameters.description: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

parameters.name: pricevaliduntil
parameters.description: The date after which the price is no longer available.

parameters.name: review
parameters.description: A review of the item. Supersedes reviews.

parameters.name: sameas
parameters.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

parameters.name: seller
parameters.description: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider. Supersedes vendor, merchant.

parameters.name: serialnumber
parameters.description: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the item.

parameters.name: validfrom
parameters.description: The date when the item becomes valid.

parameters.name: validthrough
parameters.description: The end of the validity of offer, price specification, or opening hours data.

parameters.name: warranty
parameters.description: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer. Supersedes warrantyPromise.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.name: acceptedpaymentmethod
parameters.description: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.
